result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen W Haskins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:02 PM Defendant Owen W Haskins in court with Attorney Eric P Habich.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

Statement by ADA Lazarus. Statement by Attorney Habich. Statement by Defendant.

COUNT #1   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc to Sauk County Case No. 22CF55 

CONDITIONS:
-Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Not use/possess alcohol
-DNA on file
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- DNA surcharge waived. CC and V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit for time already served: zero days credit
-Days credit if revoked: zero days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Owen W Haskins in court.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Owen W Haskins. Defn requests plea/sentencing, address verified.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:35 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Eric P Habich.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Owen W Haskins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elijah A. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2800 block of Landmark Pl in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:48 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Eric P Habich.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
